p: After 15 days, the percentage of germinated tansy seeds was 97.8% (Fig. 1a, b). Grown on BM, seedlings developed 4–5 leaves and a branched root system in 4 weeks (Fig. 1c). The in vitro grown tansy plants displayed a typical tansy phenotype with alternate and pinnately lobed leaf morphology (Fig. 1c). Healthy looking seedlings were used for the establishment of both shoot and root cultures on solid or liquid BM, respectively (Fig. 1d, e). After 4 weeks of cultivation on solid BM, average shoot length was 48.54 ± 0.2 mm, without any lateral branching. The roots cultivated in liquid BM increased their weight 3 times (from an initial 400 mg to 1.2 ± 0.03 g average). After 7 days of air-drying period, the roots’ weight was decreased with average FW/DW index = 6.02 ± 0.05.
